<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 120, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/33 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> May/June 2023 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 342]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 285, 450]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 808, 467]]<|/det|> Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|> Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|> Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|> Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 798, 544]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 892, 575]]<|/det|> You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 320, 590]]<|/det|> You may use a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 590, 578, 606]]<|/det|> You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 635, 220, 650]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 384, 667]]<|/det|> The total mark for this paper is 40. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 729, 683]]<|/det|> The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 732, 905, 860]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 650, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the motion of a pendulum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 588, 151]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a cylinder and a pendulum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 165, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 164, 808, 183]]<|/det|>
Use adhesive putty to attach the string to the cylinder as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 191, 819, 344]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 358, 532, 376]]<|/det|>
<mark>[a]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 390, 175, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 390, 677, 408]]<|/det|>
P is the point at which the string is attached to the cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 421, 648, 439]]<|/det|>
The distance between P and the centre of the bob is \(L\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 452, 764, 470]]<|/det|>
Adjust the adhesive putty and string so that \(L\) is approximately \(45 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 483, 176, 501]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 483, 384, 501]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 559, 922, 577]]<|/det|>
<form>L = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 72, 544, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 100, 688, 432]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 448, 534, 467]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 173, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 510, 519, 529]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 542, 173, 560]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 542, 628, 560]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 694, 922, 714]]<|/det|>
<form>T = .................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 850, 104]]<|/det|>
Change \(L\) by attaching a different point on the string to the cylinder and determine \(T\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(L\) and \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 747, 135]]<|/det|>
